title: Can you read Bengali books on Kindle? - Quora

response.answer_text: Yes Friends, I am using Kindle Paperwhite, it is working very well with Bengali Books. Though Amazon Book store do not have much Bengali Books, neither It is officially support for Bengali Language, but I could happily manage to get my choice of book in kindle version, mostly .mobi version which is the one format kindle’s support. Some books I have converted, some colleted and many kindle version Bengali books now freely available over Internet. As examples… bengali book “Sri Ramakrishna Kathamritha” “Bani o Rachana-Swami Vivekananda” “Sarat Rachanabali” and some works of Rabindranath working very fine for me. All are in mobi format. You can change font size easily (what is not possible in pdf format). So Friends, If you are thinking to buy Kindle Reader without any hesitation you can go. With very good battery support and Cloud storage you can enjoy very good experience of Reading.

Yes. Kindle now officially supports Indian languages including Bengali. You might be limited by the number of eBooks available on Kindle store though. Sideloading mobil files should work, if you have access to them from elsewhere.
Yes, I can! I am native Bengali and I transfer the .mobi formatted books with Bangla fonts into my Kindle Paperwhite and can read that without any problem.
